title: partners
text:
Our partner institutes play a key role in facilitating the mission and vision of COReS; to build an open community that encourages and supports them in the integration of preclinical systematic review into the research pipeline.
Learn how to become an early-adopter institute in our dynamic research community project COReS. Gain access to insights on systematic review, gain curriculum to train the next generation of researchers, collaborate with leading experts, and shape the future of biomedical research in an evidence-based way.
Contact us to learn more about becoming a Partner Institute.
See our COReS project partners below:

Building a transparent, reproducible network around preclinical evidence synthesis.

title: Join COReS Community
text:
‚ùì What is COReS?
COReS (Communities for Open Research Synthesis) equips researchers to tackle the translational gap in biomedical research with systematic reviews of preclinical data.
- Transparency & Reproducibility: Open methods, open data, open code
- Collaboration: Shared learning, shared resources
- Impact: Better-designed experiments, fewer failed translations


Join the Community ‚Üí

title: Join COReS Community
text:
üí° Why Join?

üîó Connectüìö LearnüîÑ Reproducible Research



Forge collaborations with students, PIs, and policy-makers

Participate in events, discussion threads, and special interest groups

Grow your network across disciplines




Access educational resources on systematic reviews & meta-analysis

Try interactive tutorials and quizzes at your own pace

Tap into expert office hours and webinars




Share your protocols, data, and analysis scripts publicly

Get feedback from peers to improve study design

Increase the rigor and impact of your preclinical research

title: Learn Systematic Reviews
text:
A systematic review is a rigorous method for summarising all available studies on a research question.
- Supports evidence-based decisions by providing an unbiased assessment of all available data
- Identifies effective interventions in translational biomedicine
- Provides an unbiased, data-driven overview of the literature
Want to learn more about systematic review? Check out our resources below!

title: Learn Systematic Reviews
text:
Workshops

üß™ Introduction to Systematic Reviewüî® Protocol Development‚úÖ Critical Appraisal of Animal Studiesüìä Intermediate Meta-AnalysisüöÄ Advanced Meta-Analysis


Introduction to Systematic Review & Meta-Analysis of Animal Studies
Through a mix of lectures and hands-on practical activities and tutorials across 3 half days, you will learn the major steps required to undertake a systematic review and meta-analysis of preclinical animal studies.

Course language: English 
Location: online via Teams 
ECTS: 0.9 ECTS points are awarded for this course. A certificate will be provided upon successful completion of the workshop. 
ATF-Stunden: This workshop accounts for 11 hours of continuing education. 

We have summarized the main points of the workshop in this cheat sheet.

Info & Register



Protocol Development for Systematic Review of Animal Studies  This workshop will cover the contents of a transparent and comprehensive preclinical systematic review protocol. It will cover the rationale behind registering your systematic review protocol and where to register. This workshop is aimed at researchers who already have a basic understanding of systematic reviews of animal data.

Course language: English 
Location: online via Teams 
Prerequisites: Attendance at the Introduction to Systematic Review & Meta-Analysis of Animal Studies workshop or similar systematic review experience. 


Info & Register



Critical Appraisal of Animal Studies: Practical Workshop  This interactive practical workshop explores study quality and risks of bias, internal and external validity, in scientific publications of animal experiments. Participants will gain hands-on experience critically appraising published animal experiments.

Course language: English 
Location: online via Teams 


Info & Register



Intermediate Meta-Analysis of Data From Animal Studies in R  Meta-analysis is a rigorous statistical method that systematically combines and synthesizes results from multiple independent studies. By aggregating data across multiple research outputs, meta-analysis provides a powerful tool for drawing robust conclusions, identifying patterns, and quantifying effect sizes.
During this intensive workshop, participants will delve into the practicalities of conducting meta-analysis on animal studies. From understanding data types to mastering meta-regression modelling techniques, this course equips learners with practical skills to conduct robust meta-analyses. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned researcher or a curious novice, join us to develop hands-on skills in conducting meta-analysis on data from animal experiments using R.

Course language: English 
Location: online via Teams 
ECTS: no, only certificates of attendance are given 
Prerequisites: We recommend completion of the Introduction to Systematic Review & Meta-Analysis of Animal Studies and basic familiarity with R, see meta-analysis tutorial web-application for more information. 


Info & Register ‚Üí



Advanced Meta-Analysis Techniques for Synthesizing Data From Animal Studies  During this advanced workshop, participants will delve into the practicalities of conducting advanced meta-analytic techniques suitable for synthesising data from animal studies, namely multi-level meta-analysis and individual animal analysis. Prior to attending this workshop, we recommend first-hand experience conducting meta-analysis of animal studies, as well as intermediate experience with R, see meta-analysis tutorial web-application for more information.

Course language: English 
Location: online via Teams 
ECTS: no, only certificates of attendance are given 


Info & Register ‚Üí

title: Perform Systematic Reviews
text: Want to start a systematic review? ‚Äì Look no further, we‚Äôve got you covered for resources and support!

title: Perform Systematic Reviews
text:
Wiki on Systematic Review
Our wiki resources on systematic review are designed to support you in conducting comprehensive and reliable reviews. You will find a wealth of information, including helpful references, to guide you through the process and ensure your reviews are thorough and well-informed.
Take me to the wiki ‚Üí

title: Perform Systematic Reviews
text:
Software for Systematic Review - SyRF
Looking for a flexible systematic review software tailored for animal research? SyRF is your solution! SyRF streamlines the review process, saving you time and effort. Create your free account today.
Take me to SyRF ‚Üó For guidance on how to use the platform, tutorials, and step-by-step instructions, please see the extensive help guide.
How to Use SyRF ‚Üó
